meanings.definition: In a weak or feeble manner.
meanings.sent1: She ran weakliest in the race, barely making it to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: He spoke weakliest when he was feeling unwell.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to meow weakliest, but it came out as a tiny squeak.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge swayed weakliest in the wind, looking like it might collapse at any moment.
meanings.sent5: Her voice trembled weakliest as she tried to speak up in the meeting.

meanings.definition: To the smallest degree of weakness.
meanings.sent1: He weakliest lifted the heavy box, struggling to keep it off the ground.
meanings.sent2: She weakliest pushed the door open, not having enough strength to do it easily.
meanings.sent3: The tree weakliest swayed in the breeze, almost as if it was too tired to move.
meanings.sent4: The candle weakliest flickered in the dark room, barely illuminating anything.
meanings.sent5: The athlete weakliest crossed the finish line, exhausted from the long race.
